page.title: 10GRAND WESTERN CANAL
page.content: In{1796}an Act was obtained for the construction of the{Grand Western {Canal.}The intention was that the canal should run from Taunton to Topsham with three branches going off to Tiverton,Cullompton and Wellington. {The Grand Western Canal}runs from Tiverton to Lowdwells, but the last half between Great Fossend and Lowdwells is dried up.Between Halberton and Sampford Peverell there are four bridges-Greenway,Swingbridge, Rock and Battens. It is very calm by the canal nowadays and there are barges which you can ride up and down the canal. The barges are pulled up and down the canal by shire horses walking along a pathway.The canal is also used for fishing and water festivals to amuse people.
